definition: see 隔三差五|隔三差五[ge2 san1 cha4 wu3]
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
fork in road/bifurcation/branch in road, river, mountain range etc/to branch off/to turn off/to diverge/to stray (from the path)/to change the subject/to interrupt/to stagger (times)

sentences.english: You may run out of your house and forget to lock the door once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 隔三岔五就会慌慌张张地从家里跑出去忘记锁门吧？

sentences.english: Some people grumble said, if regularly rising, how does let the human live?
sentences.chinese: 有人发牢骚说，要是隔三岔五的涨，让人怎么活啊？

definition: lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
gradually/little by little/in the course of time
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
to have a large and sumptuous meal (traditionally on the 1st and 15th of each month)
neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
